s2.message: The Adblock Plus coding style is based on others. The general section below overrules any referenced style guides, and the language specific sections overrule the general section.

s4.message: Consistency is most important: Be consistent within functions, files, modules and projects. Making existing code conform with this style guide is fine, but it should happen in dedicated commits, preferably for a whole module or project at once.

s6.message: Follow the Mozilla Coding Style's general practices and its naming and formatting rules.

s7.message: All files should have a license header, but no mode line comments.

s9.message: Lines can be longer than 80 characters if limiting line length would hurt readability in a particular case.

s10.message: Opening braces always go on their own line.

s11.message: No hungarian notation, no special variable name prefixes or suffixes denoting type or scope.

s13.message: Follow the Mozilla Coding Style's JavaScript practices.

s14.message: Opening braces of object literals don't go on their own line.

s17.message: to ensure the desired value of the

s19.message: variable, donâ€™t use temporary variables as a replacement.

s20.message: In classes, prefix private functions with a single underscore to make them pseudo-private.

s22.message: Follow the Mozilla Coding Style's Python practices.

s23.message: In modules, prefix private functions and variables with a single underscore.

s25.message: Follow the Mozilla Coding Style's Java practices.

s27.message: Follow the Mozilla Coding Style's C++ practices.

s32.message: Avoid manual memory management: Use references and values when possible, smart pointers when necessary, raw pointers only for weak references.

s35.message: Opening braces don't go on their own line.
